alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 3:39AM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Occasional snow or freezing rain this morning, then heavy snow developing this afternoon. Heavy snow expected tonight through Thursday morning, tapering to snow showers Thursday afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 24 inches expected above 4000 feet, with the heaviest accumulations above 5000 feet in elevation. Spotty ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible as well. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will likely cause blowing and drifting of snow, and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades above 4000 feet. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 8 AM this morning to 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel conditions are expected to be difficult. Expect snow and ice covered roads and greatly reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Be prepared for winter driving conditions with snow and ice covered roads and very limited visibility. If you must travel in the mountains, slow down, and allow plenty of extra time to reach your destination. Allow extra following distance to the vehicle in front of you, and keep snow chains and a winter survival kit, including a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
